sub_title: Political Scientist, Researcher, Lecturer @AUL, Podcaster @Europe Elects
summary:
Salut!

You just encountered a multi-lingual problem-solver that luckily ended up being employed in any (almost) kind of institution that a contemporary job market may offer: NGO, political party, a non-profit think-tank, government regulatory agency, university, financial consultancy, and many other ambitious small-scale entities. 

All in all, I continuously communicated, researched, analyzed, wrote, and taught.

At the end of the day, we are what we have experienced. A worrisome trend I am witnessing over the years is the culture of regret that dispenses remorse to countless individuals. Combined with job market instabilities and somewhat problematic recruitment practices, many of us question our career choices.

Nonetheless, regret is a counter-productive concept. It makes us stuck in the past, dissatisfied today, and insecure about the future. To have a prosperous society, we need individuals willing to embrace their experiences, victories and defeats, gains and losses, and ups and downs. So, let's focus on what makes us more fulfilled human beings. Undoubtedly, the rest is history. 

Long story short, what’s the future for me, you would ask?

Well, I still want to continuously communicate, research, analyze, write, and teach, I’d say.

As a political scientist, I teach Bachelor students in regional studies, work on scholarly articles, contribute to various magazines, blogs, and periodicals with my take on the ongoing developments around us, and prepare for my Doctoral studies for the next academic year, probably somewhere in Europe.

Shoot me a message as I would love to chat with you.

In our weekly episodes, we bring you updates from across Europe, unpacking the latest news, polls, and trends. In the Headlines, we bring you the top stories from the continent, in the Breakdown, we dive deep into a key issue with politicians, journalists, and academic experts, and in History Corner we go back in time to analyze the impacts of a key election in European history.

Europe Elects is a market leader in the analysis of polls and election data in Europe. The Germany-based start-up contextualizes the data for free for 204,000 followers (updated: 28 May 2021) on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Telegram, and YouTube, and has provided analysis to Al Jazeera, Euronews, Heinrich-Boell Foundation, the University of Georgia, and other major international stakeholders in the past. Moreover, Europe Elects act as a democracy watchdog in authoritarian countries. During Europe Elects’ work, the platform breaks the national narrative and reports from a European perspective for a pan-European audience.
